016package de.cuioss.test.jsf.junit5;
017
018import java.io.Serializable;
019import java.util.Optional;
020import java.util.Set;
021
022import javax.inject.Named;
023
024import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;
025import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
026
027import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.api.ObjectContractTestSupport;
028import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.api.contracts.VerifyBeanProperty;
029import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.api.object.ObjectTestConfig;
030import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.api.object.ObjectTestContracts;
031import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.contract.BeanPropertyContractImpl;
032import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.objects.ConfigurationCallBackHandler;
033import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.objects.ParameterizedInstantiator;
034import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.objects.RuntimeProperties;
035import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.objects.impl.BeanInstantiator;
036import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.objects.impl.CallbackAwareInstantiator;
037import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.objects.impl.DefaultInstantiator;
038import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.util.AnnotationHelper;
039import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.util.ObjectContractHelper;
040import de.cuioss.tools.reflect.MoreReflection;
041import lombok.AccessLevel;
042import lombok.Getter;
043
044/**
045 * Base class for testing {@link Named} beans. The test runs implicitly
046 * {@link VerifyBeanProperty}, therefore the annotation is optional, but it can
047 * be used for further configuration.
048 * <p>
049 * As default all {@link ObjectTestContracts} a run, see
050 * {@link #shouldImplementObjectContracts()}
051 * </p>
052 * <p>
053 * Documentation on how to setup the generator can be found at
054 * {@link AbstractPropertyAwareFacesTest}
055 * </p>
056 * <p>
057 * Documentation on the setup of the JSF-related test-infrastructure can be
058 * found at {@link EnableJsfEnvironment}
059 * </p>
060 * <p>
061 * It acts as an {@link ConfigurationCallBackHandler}, saying after
062 * initialization and prior to testing the method {@link #configure(Object)}
063 * will be called allowing the concrete test-class to do some specific
064 * configuration e.g. calling init-methods and such.
065 * </p>
066 * <p>
067 * You can easily access pre-configured instance by calling {@link #anyBean()}.
068 * </p>
069 *
070 * @author Oliver Wolff
071 * @param <T> identifying the type to be tested is usually but not necessarily
072 *            at least {@link Serializable}.
073 */
074public abstract class AbstractBeanTest<T> extends AbstractPropertyAwareFacesTest<T>
075        implements ObjectContractTestSupport {
076
077    /** The active object-contracts to be tested */
078    private Set<ObjectTestContracts> activeObjectContracts;
079
080    /**
081     * Needed {@link ParameterizedInstantiator} for creating test Objects or
082     * {@link #shouldImplementObjectContracts()}
083     */
084    @Getter(AccessLevel.PROTECTED)
085    private ParameterizedInstantiator<T> instantiator;
086
087    /**
088     * Initializes the object-test-contracts and the corresponding
089     * {@link ParameterizedInstantiator}
090     */
091    @BeforeEach
092    void before() {
093        activeObjectContracts = ObjectContractHelper.handleVetoedContracts(getClass());
094        Optional<VerifyBeanProperty> annotation = MoreReflection.extractAnnotation(getClass(),
095                VerifyBeanProperty.class);
096        ParameterizedInstantiator<T> inlineInstantiator;
097        if (annotation.isPresent()) {
098            var meta = AnnotationHelper.handleMetadataForPropertyTest(getClass(), getPropertyMetadata());
099            inlineInstantiator = new BeanInstantiator<>(new DefaultInstantiator<>(getTargetBeanClass()),
100                    new RuntimeProperties(meta));
101        } else {
102            inlineInstantiator = new BeanInstantiator<>(new DefaultInstantiator<>(getTargetBeanClass()),
103                    new RuntimeProperties(getPropertyMetadata()));
104        }
105        instantiator = new CallbackAwareInstantiator<>(inlineInstantiator, this);
106    }
107
108    @Override
109    @Test
110    public void shouldImplementObjectContracts() {
111        final var objectTestConfig = this.getClass().getAnnotation(ObjectTestConfig.class);
112        for (final ObjectTestContracts objectTestContracts : activeObjectContracts) {
113            objectTestContracts.newObjectTestInstance().assertContract(getInstantiator(), objectTestConfig);
114        }
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * Tests the individually found properties, see {@link VerifyBeanProperty}
119     */
120    @Test
121    void shouldImplementBeanContract() {
122        new BeanPropertyContractImpl<>(getInstantiator()).assertContract();
123    }
124
125    /**
126     * @return a fully configured instance of the bean with
127     *         {@link #configure(Object)} being already called. 'Fully configured'
128     *         is defined as all attributes that can be generated by corresponding
129     *         generators are set
130     */
131    public T anyBean() {
132        return getInstantiator().newInstanceFull();
133    }
134
135}
